Issues.Title: globals.css base value issues
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

    "tailwindcss": "^4.1.12"

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

    "next": "^15.5.0",

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

V22

**What browser are you using?**

Brave, Chrome tested

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways.

A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue ‚Äî any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves.

**Describe your issue**

I got mono repo with turbo, using shared libraries for tailwind for nextjs apps,
I see in 1 app all works fine, and the others are loosing the configuration. I doubted tht its configuration related which isn't possible cause their config is also shared!

@import "tailwindcss";

@variant dark (&:where(.dark, .dark *));
@variant motion-safe (&:where(:not([data-reduced-motion="reduce"])));
@variant motion-reduce (&:where([data-reduced-motion="reduce"]));
@variant contrast-more (&:where([data-contrast="more"]));
@variant contrast-less (&:where([data-contrast="less"]));

@theme {
  --font-sans: "Roboto", "Noto Sans", Arial, sans-serif;
  --font-mono: "Roboto Mono", Consolas, monospace;

  --color-primary: oklch(0.55 0.15 260);
  --color-primary-foreground: oklch(0.98 0.02 260);
  --color-secondary: oklch(0.95 0.02 260);
  --color-secondary-foreground: oklch(0.15 0.05 260);
  --color-muted: oklch(0.92 0.02 260);
  --color-muted-foreground: oklch(0.45 0.03 260);
  --color-accent: oklch(0.88 0.04 260);
  --color-accent-foreground: oklch(0.15 0.05 260);
  --color-destructive: oklch(0.62 0.25 29);
  --color-destructive-foreground: oklch(0.98 0.02 29);
  --color-card: oklch(1 0 0);
  --color-card-foreground: oklch(0.09 0.01 260);
  --color-background: oklch(1 0 0);
  --color-foreground: oklch(0.09 0.01 260);
  --color-border: oklch(0.88 0.02 260);

  /* Sidebar colors */
  --color-sidebar: hsl(0 0% 98%);
  --color-sidebar-foreground: hsl(240 5.3% 26.1%);
  --color-sidebar-primary: hsl(240 5.9% 10%);
  --color-sidebar-primary-foreground: hsl(0 0% 98%);
  --color-sidebar-accent: hsl(240 4.8% 95.9%);
  --color-sidebar-accent-foreground: hsl(240 5.9% 10%);
  --color-sidebar-border: hsl(220 13% 91%);
  --color-sidebar-ring: hsl(217.2 91.2% 59.8%);
}

@layer base {
  .dark {
    --color-primary: oklch(0.65 0.15 260);
    --color-primary-foreground: oklch(0.09 0.02 260);
    --color-secondary: oklch(0.15 0.02 260);
    --color-secondary-foreground: oklch(0.85 0.02 260);
    --color-muted: oklch(0.18 0.02 260);
    --color-muted-foreground: oklch(0.65 0.03 260);
    --color-accent: oklch(0.22 0.04 260);
    --color-accent-foreground: oklch(0.85 0.05 260);
    --color-destructive: oklch(0.72 0.25 29);
    --color-destructive-foreground: oklch(0.09 0.02 29);
    --color-card: oklch(0.09 0.01 260);
    --color-card-foreground: oklch(0.92 0.01 260);
    --color-background: oklch(0.09 0.01 260);
    --color-foreground: oklch(0.92 0.01 260);
    --color-border: oklch(0.22 0.02 260);

    /* Sidebar dark overrides */
    --color-sidebar: hsl(240 5.9% 10%);
    --color-sidebar-foreground: hsl(240 4.8% 95.9%);
    --color-sidebar-primary: hsl(224.3 76.3% 48%);
    --color-sidebar-primary-foreground: hsl(0 0% 100%);
    --color-sidebar-accent: hsl(240 3.7% 15.9%);
    --color-sidebar-accent-foreground: hsl(240 4.8% 95.9%);
    --color-sidebar-border: hsl(240 3.7% 15.9%);
    --color-sidebar-ring: hsl(217.2 91.2% 59.8%);
  }
}

@layer utilities {
  .text-balance {
    text-wrap: balance;
  }
  .text-pretty {
    text-wrap: pretty;
  }

  .scrollbar-thin {
    scrollbar-width: thin;
  }
  .scrollbar-none {
    scrollbar-width: none;
    -ms-overflow-style: none;
  }
  .scrollbar-none::-webkit-scrollbar {
    display: none;
  }
}
@layer base {
  * {
    border-color: var(--color-border);
    outline-color: color-mix(
      in srgb,
      var(--color-ring, var(--color-primary)) 50%,
      transparent
    );
  }
  body {
    background-color: var(--color-background);
    color: var(--color-foreground);
  }
}

+++

everything is shared, I just import globals.css at layout and try to use, only working fine at first application, on the rest, there are broken details for CSS like

md:hidden value isn't being generated so where I use md:hidden, is not working?? but it is working for other app which they are running at the same time, same config, same code, same header/footer, same styling

I use md hidden for hamburger icon, there are 4 apps, icon is visible at 3 of them in desktop mode, but not in 1 of them. I know sounds a lot of configuration wise issue, but its not! when I manually add md:hidden to globals things are becoming fine???
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "globals.css base value issues" (#18772)

Issues.Title: fix(sr-only): replace deprecated clip with clip-path inset(50%) (#18768)
Issues.Body:
<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create a discussion to first discuss any significant new features.

For more info, check out the contributing guide:

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->

## Summary

This PR replaces the deprecated `clip` property used in the `sr-only` utility with `clip-path`, and updates the corresponding reset in `not-sr-only`.

- Closes [tailwindlabs/tailwindcss#18768](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/issues/18768)
- Replaces `clip: rect(0, 0, 0, 0);` with `clip-path: inset(50%);` in `sr-only`
- Replaces `clip: auto;` with `clip-path: none;` in `not-sr-only`
- Updates unit test snapshots to reflect the new CSS output

Rationale:

- `clip` is deprecated and flagged by modern linters; `clip-path` is the recommended modern alternative while preserving the intended visually-hidden behavior.

Before:

```css
.sr-only {
  clip: rect(0, 0, 0, 0);
}

.not-sr-only {
  clip: auto;
}
```

After:

```css
.sr-only {
  clip-path: inset(50%);
}

.not-sr-only {
  clip-path: none;
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(sr-only): replace deprecated clip with clip-path inset(50%) (#18768)" (#18769)

Issues.Title: Suggestion: Replace deprecated `clip` in `sr-only` with `clip-path`
Issues.Body: ### What version of Tailwind CSS are you using? v4.1.12 ### Describe your issue Use any markup with `sr-only`, e.g.: ```html Hidden text for screen readers ``` The `sr-only` utility currently relies on the deprecated `clip` property (`clip: rect(0, 0, 0, 0);`). According to MDN, `clip` is deprecated and authors are encouraged to use `clip-path` instead. This causes: - Linting errors in modern toolchains (e.g., stylelint `property-no-deprecated`) - Risk of future breakage if browsers remove support Reference: [MDN: clip ‚Äî Deprecated; authors are encouraged to use clip-path](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clip) ### Proposed solution Replace the use of `clip` in `sr-only` with `clip-path: inset(50%)`, which preserves the intended visually-hidden behavior without using deprecated properties. ```ts staticUtility('sr-only', [ ['position', 'absolute'], ['width', '1px'], ['height', '1px'], ['padding', '0'], ['margin', '-1px'], ['overflow', 'hidden'], ['clip-path', 'inset(50%)'], ['white-space', 'nowrap'], ['border-width', '0'], ]) staticUtility('not-sr-only', [ ['position', 'static'], ['width', 'auto'], ['height', 'auto'], ['padding', '0'], ['margin', '0'], ['overflow', 'visible'], ['clip-path', 'none'], ['white-space', 'normal'], ]) ``` Notes: - Keeps the same accessibility semantics (element remains available to AT, not visually rendered). - Removes reliance on a deprecated property. - Plays well with modern linters and build pipelines. Optional fallback (only if supporting very old browsers is required): ```css @supports (clip-path: inset(50%)) { .sr-only { clip-path: inset(50%); } } /* Otherwise keep current behavior or document a linter override */ ``` Expected outcome: - No visual or behavioral regressions for visually-hidden content. - No linter errors related to deprecated CSS properties. - Aligns Tailwind utilities with current CSS standards per MDN.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Suggestion: Replace deprecated `clip` in `sr-only` with `clip-path`" (#18768)

Issues.Title: Prototype loading `@plugin` and `@config` from non-default exports
Issues.Body: This will make using `@config` less necessary for plugins which don't use `export default`. Added to `@config` for feature parity.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Prototype loading `@plugin` and `@config` from non-default exports" (#18766)

Issues.Title: [v4] In a production environment, the theme does not contain breakpoint variables
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v4.1.12 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** For example: Next.js 14.2.25 **What version of Node.js are you using?** For example: v22.18.0 **What browser are you using?** For example: Chrome, Safari **What operating system are you using?** For example: macOS **Describe your issue** Also, breakpoint styles are not applied ### globals.css ``` css @import "tailwindcss"; @theme { --spacing: 1px; --breakpoint-base: 450px; --breakpoint-tablet: 900px; --breakpoint-mobile: 450px; --breakpoint-pc: 1200px; --color-transparent: transparent; --color-white: #ffffff; --color-black: #000000; --color-gray-50: #f9f9f9; --color-gray-100: #f5f5f5; --color-gray-200: #e5ebee; --color-gray-300: #d1d5db; --color-gray-400: #9ca3ad; --color-gray-500: #6d727d; --color-gray-600: #4d5665; --color-gray-700: #39404f; --color-gray-800: #222837; --color-gray-900: #131825; --color-gray-950: #1e1e1e; --color-blue-500: #3b82f6; --color-blue-50: #eff6ff; --color-red-500: #ef4444; --color-red-50: #fee2e2; --color-pink-50: #fdf2f8; --color-pink-500: #ec4899; --color-amber-500: #f59e0b; --color-amber-50: #fffbeb; --color-brand-500: #eb3f3f; --color-brand-100: #ffefef; --color-brand-50: #fff9f9; --color-emerald-500: #10b981; --color-yellow-500: #fde047; --text-12: 12px; --text-12--line-height: 18px; --text-13: 13px; --text-14: 14px; --text-15: 15px; --text-16: 16px; --text-17: 17px; --text-18: 18px; --text-20: 20px; --text-28: 28px; --text-32: 32px; --text-40: 40px; --z-index-modal: 1000; --z-index-dim: 999; --z-index-header: 998; } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[v4] In a production environment, the theme does not contain breakpoint variables" (#18762)

Issues.Title: Update @napi-rs/wasm-runtime 0.2.12 ‚Üí 1.0.3 (major)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this upgrade. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è @‚Äãnapi-rs/wasm-runtime (0.2.12 ‚Üí 1.0.3) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/napi-rs/napi-rs)
Release Notes

1.0.0

Breaking changes

Module register

The old way:

register_module!(test_module, init);

fn init(module: &mut Module) -> Result<()> {
  // ....
  Ok(())
}

The new way:

#[module_exports]
fn init(mut exports: JsObject) -> Result<()> {
  // ...
  Ok(())
}

or

#[module_exports]
fn init(mut exports: JsObject, env: Env) -> Result<()> {
  // ...
  Ok(())
}

Task

- pub trait Task: Send {
+ pub trait Task: Send + Sized {
    type Output: Send + Sized + 'static;
    type JsValue: NapiValue;


-   fn compute(&self) -> Result<Self::Output>;
+   fn compute(&mut self) -> Result<Self::Output>;


-   fn resolve(&self, env: &mut Env, output: Self::Output) -> Result<Self::JsValue>;
+   fn resolve(self, env: Env, output: Self::Output) -> Result<Self::JsValue>;


+   fn reject(self, _env: Env, err: Error) -> Result<Self::JsValue> {
+     Err(err)
+   }
}

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Sorry, we couldn't find anything useful about this release. --- ![Depfu Status](https://depfu.com/badges/edd6acd35d74c8d41cbb540c30442adf/stats.svg) [Depfu](https://depfu.com) will automatically keep this PR conflict-free, as long as you don't add any commits to this branch yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting with `@depfu rebase`.
All Depfu comment commands
@‚Äãdepfu rebase
Rebases against your default branch and redoes this update
@‚Äãdepfu recreate
Recreates this PR, overwriting any edits that you've made to it
@‚Äãdepfu merge
Merges this PR once your tests are passing and conflicts are resolved
@‚Äãdepfu cancel merge
Cancels automatic merging of this PR
@‚Äãdepfu close
Closes this PR and deletes the branch
@‚Äãdepfu reopen
Restores the branch and reopens this PR (if it's closed)
@‚Äãdepfu pause
Ignores all future updates for this dependency and closes this PR
@‚Äãdepfu pause [minor|major]
Ignores all future minor/major updates for this dependency and closes this PR
@‚Äãdepfu resume
Future versions of this dependency will create PRs again (leaves this PR as is)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update @napi-rs/wasm-runtime 0.2.12 ‚Üí 1.0.3 (major)" (#18757)

Issues.Title: Invalid transform: ; Output in Generated CSS with @tailwindcss/postcss@4.1.1
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** 4.1.1 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** "vite": "^6.0.5" "@vitejs/plugin-react": "^4.3.4", "@tailwindcss/postcss": "4.1.1", **What version of Node.js are you using?** v20.18.2 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** macOs **Reproduction URL** clone https://github.com/mcdhage98/ui-component-library steps to reproduce 1)yarn 2)yarn run build 3) check https://github.com/mcdhage98/ui-component-library/blob/0c6e23b426b24053443ec193fdb952fb87353b12/dist/styles/index.css#L965 **Describe your issue** Previously i was using "@tailwindcss/postcss": "^4.0.7", was getting proper class after build .ui\:transform { transform: var(--tw-rotate-x,) var(--tw-rotate-y,) var(--tw-rotate-z,) var(--tw-skew-x,) var(--tw-skew-y,); } after upgradation to 4.1.1 im getting extra line "transform: ; " .ui\:transform { transform: ; transform: var(--tw-rotate-x,) var(--tw-rotate-y,) var(--tw-rotate-z,) var(--tw-skew-x,) var(--tw-skew-y,); } Error Im using this library in a project which uses sass The error occurs during the build process in the sass-loader when processing the CSS file located at ./node_modules/ui-components/dist/styles/index.css. Specifically, at line 965, column 25, there is an invalid transform property with an empty value (transform: ;), causing a SassError: Expected expression. This breaks the build because Sass expects a valid expression after the transform property. The issue is likely caused by a misconfiguration in the PostCSS pipeline,
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Invalid transform: ; Output in Generated CSS with @tailwindcss/postcss@4.1.1" (#18754)

Issues.Title: Typography utilities have redundant properties that can be improved.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.1.11

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

N/A

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

N/A

**What browser are you using?**

FireFox

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

[tailwind playground](https://play.tailwindcss.com/mDuEQwGGpP)

**Describe your issue**

<Note: I'm study tailwind source code>

The Typography utilities `letter-spacing`(tracking-) and `font-weight`(font-) have redundant properties.

example: (see the tailwind playground link)

.font-thin {
  --tw-font-weight: var(--font-weight-thin); <- redundant property
  font-weight: var(--font-weight-thin); <- just use this is fine
}

.tracking-normal {
  --tw-tracking: var(--tracking-normal); <- redundant property
  letter-spacing: var(--tracking-normal);<- just use this is fine
}

I don't see var(--tw-font-weight) or var(--tw-tracking) used anywhere in the Typography utilities.
Are those used somewhere?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Typography utilities have redundant properties that can be improved." (#18740)

Issues.Title: Tailwind compilation takes forever on css files delete / add
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

4.1

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Vite 7

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Describe your issue**

1. Install React, tailwindcss, @tailwindcss/cli and @tailwindcss/vite
2. Create CSS file with content:
```
@import 'tailwindcss'
```
3. Compile the file using CLI or Vite (takes <1s on fresh install)
4. Add another CSS (can be anything)
5. Source the other CSS in a React component
6. Compile the file using CLI or Vite (takes <1s)
7. Delete the other CSS file
8. Compile tailwind using CLI or Vite - **takes 2-3 minutes**

I've deleted my `node_modules` and tried this but to no avail. I wonder if it's a .git cache issue or some cache issue that I cannot find. It would be helpful if the CLI had debug logs.

**CLI output**
```
‚âà tailwindcss v4.1.12

Done in 2m

[179480.61ms] [@tailwindcss/cli] (initial build)
[    15.20ms]   ‚Ü≥ Setup compiler
[179383.89ms]   ‚Ü≥ Scan for candidates
[    76.52ms]   ‚Ü≥ Build CSS
[     3.66ms]   ‚Ü≥ Write output
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tailwind compilation takes forever on css files delete / add" (#18737)

Issues.Title: Drop warning from browser build
Issues.Body:
To ignore warnings when using the CDN, just add no-warn.
No src check was added since the CDN URL might vary (e.g., not always https://cdn.tailwindcss.com).

```html
<script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com" no-warn></script>
```


https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/issues/18731
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Drop warning from browser build" (#18732)

Issues.Title: The browser console warnings persist when using TailwindCSS's CDN link, with no built-in way to disable them.
Issues.Body:
I used AI to generate the HTML for me and employed Tailwind CSS for layout, so it must import the full CSS on the page rather than bundling it...
Is it possible to add an attribute to remove the warning, like this:
``` <script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com" no-warn></script> ```

Issues.Title: .hdr files causes invalid codepoint 1234
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

4.1.11

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Angular 20.1, in NX 23.1 using Vite 6.3.5

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

22.16

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

MacOS

**Reproduction URL**

Download a hdr file such as https://polyhaven.com/a/brown_photostudio_01
then place it anywhere in your project


**Describe your issue**

This will cause tailwind to error out at startup with

RangeError: Invalid code point 2430513
app:     at Function.fromCodePoint (<anonymous>)
app:     at /Users/leon/.../node_modules/.pnpm/tailwindcss@4.1.11/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:1:4772


## Solution
I think if we add it to the binary text file here it would solve it
https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/main/crates/oxide/src/scanner/fixtures/binary-extensions.txt
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".hdr files causes invalid codepoint 1234" (#18733)

Issues.Title: Mark `.hdr` and `.exr` as binary extensions
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes an issue where `.hdr` files were scanned for candidates even though it's a binary file.

As a workaround today, you could use:

```css
@source not "**/*.hdr";
```

To ignore `.hdr` files, but let's bake it in by default instead.

Fixes: #18733
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Mark `.hdr` and `.exr` as binary extensions" (#18734)

Issues.Title: Is --tw-scale-z property redundant in scale-* utility?
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.1.11

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: macOS

**Reproduction URL**

[tailwind play](https://play.tailwindcss.com/H5bjP0PiuN)

**Describe your issue**

Question: Does `scale-*` utility have redundant `--tw-scale-z` property?

example: 

.scale-50 {
  --tw-scale-x: 50%;
  --tw-scale-y: 50%;
  --tw-scale-z: 50%; <- is this redundant?
  scale: var(--tw-scale-x) var(--tw-scale-y); <- there is no var(--tw-scale-z), it's no making sense!
}


the only situation of using `var(--tw-scale-z)` is using `scale-z-*` utility.

.scale-z-50 {
  --tw-scale-z: 50%; <- `scale-50` will get --tw-scale-z property, but when use `scale-z-50`, it will override it.
  scale: var(--tw-scale-x) var(--tw-scale-y) var(--tw-scale-z); 
}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Is --tw-scale-z property redundant in scale-* utility?" (#18727)

Issues.Title: TailwindCSS styles not applied in Vite sandbox preview server
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.4.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

remix-run/react 2.17.0, vite 6.0.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.0.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/btbrandon/sandbox-bug-reproduction

**Describe your issue**

I‚Äôm running a Remix + Vite + TailwindCSS app inside my custom ‚Äúsandbox‚Äù runner (an Express + Vite dev server that copies my project into /private/tmp/... and spins up Vite there).

What I expected: Tailwind utility classes should be applied in the sandbox preview exactly the same as in my local IDE dev server or my production deploy.

What actually happens: In the sandbox preview, none of my TailwindCSS classes take effect‚Äîlayouts collapse, maps don‚Äôt render full-height, component styles are missing, etc.

I get warnings even though the set up is correct:
```
warn - The `content` option in your Tailwind CSS configuration is missing or empty.
warn - Configure your content sources or your generated CSS will be missing styles.
warn - https://tailwindcss.com/docs/content-configuration
```

**Linked issue from Vite**
https://github.com/vitejs/vite/issues/20553
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TailwindCSS styles not applied in Vite sandbox preview server" (#18710)

Issues.Title: Update @napi-rs/wasm-runtime 0.2.12 ‚Üí 1.0.1 (major)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this upgrade. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è @‚Äãnapi-rs/wasm-runtime (0.2.12 ‚Üí 1.0.1) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/napi-rs/napi-rs)
Release Notes

1.0.0

Breaking changes

Module register

The old way:

register_module!(test_module, init);

fn init(module: &mut Module) -> Result<()> {
  // ....
  Ok(())
}

The new way:

#[module_exports]
fn init(mut exports: JsObject) -> Result<()> {
  // ...
  Ok(())
}

or

#[module_exports]
fn init(mut exports: JsObject, env: Env) -> Result<()> {
  // ...
  Ok(())
}

Task

- pub trait Task: Send {
+ pub trait Task: Send + Sized {
    type Output: Send + Sized + 'static;
    type JsValue: NapiValue;


-   fn compute(&self) -> Result<Self::Output>;
+   fn compute(&mut self) -> Result<Self::Output>;


-   fn resolve(&self, env: &mut Env, output: Self::Output) -> Result<Self::JsValue>;
+   fn resolve(self, env: Env, output: Self::Output) -> Result<Self::JsValue>;


+   fn reject(self, _env: Env, err: Error) -> Result<Self::JsValue> {
+     Err(err)
+   }
}

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Sorry, we couldn't find anything useful about this release. --- ![Depfu Status](https://depfu.com/badges/edd6acd35d74c8d41cbb540c30442adf/stats.svg) [Depfu](https://depfu.com) will automatically keep this PR conflict-free, as long as you don't add any commits to this branch yourself. Issues.Body:
## Summary

Even though [`@ampproject/remapping`](https://npm.im/@ampproject/remapping) isn't deprecated on npm (yet), it's [repo](https://github.com/ampproject/remapping) is archived, so people should move to [`@jridgewell/remapping`](https://npm.im/@jridgewell/remapping)

> Development moved to [monorepo](https://github.com/jridgewell/sourcemaps)
> See https://github.com/jridgewell/sourcemaps/tree/main/packages/remapping for latest code.

---

I'm sure people from the wider @e18e ecosystem cleanup (like @43081j, @benmccann, @Fuzzyma, @outslept & @talentlessguy) will be very happy to see these kind of changes as well

[ci-all]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "update `@ampproject/remapping` to `@jridgewell/remapping`" (#18716)

Issues.Title: Fix false-positive migrations in `addEventListener` and JavaScript variable names
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes 2 false-positives when running the upgrade tool on a Tailwind CSS v3 project converting it to a Tailwind CSS v4 project.

The issue occurs around migrations with short simple names that have a meaning outside if Tailwind CSS, e.g. `blur` and `outline`.

This PR fixes 2 such cases:


1. The `addEventListener` case:

   ```js
   document.addEventListener('blur', handleBlur)
   ```

   We do this by special casing the `addEventListener(` case and making sure the first argument to `addEventListener` is never migrated.

2. A JavaScript variable with default value:

   ```js
   function foo({ foo = "bar", outline = true, baz = "qux" }) {
     // ...
   }
   ```

   The bug is relatively subtle here, but it has actually nothing to do with `outline` itself, but rather the fact that some quote character came before and after it on the same line...

   One of our heuristics for determining if a migration on these small words is safe, is to ensure that the candidate is inside of a string. Since we didn't do any kind of quote balancing, we would consider the `outline` to be inside of a string, even though it is not.

   So to actually solve this, we do some form of quote balancing to ensure that it's _not_ inside of a string in this case.

Additionally, this PR also introduces a small refactor to the `is-safe-migration.test.ts` file where we now use a `test.each` to ensure that failing tests in the middle don't prevent the rest of the tests from running.

### Test plan

1. Added dedicated tests for the cases mentioned in the issue (#18675).
2. Added a few more tests with various forms of whitespace.

Fixes: #18675
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix false-positive migrations in `addEventListener` and JavaScript variable names" (#18718)

Issues.Title: space-y-* or space-x-* incorrect behaviour on reverse
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v4.1.7

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Angular CLI v20 - should be vite v7.0.6

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v22

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/upgrade-guide#space-between-selector

**Describe your issue**

In Tailwind CSS v4, it improved performance of `space-x-*` and `space-y-*` by utilize on `:not(:last-child)` instead of `* + *` CSS condition. Where it introduce new bug if it is used with `space-x-reverse` or `space-y-reverse`. In reverse order, it should be `:not(:first-child)`. Else the last element will **missing margin top**, where first will have margin top that it **should not have**.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "space-y-* or space-x-* incorrect behaviour on reverse" (#18717)

Issues.Title: generated class with has-[role=*] showing syntax error warning
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
4.1.11

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss, Angular 20.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
22.x

**What browser are you using?**
N/A

**What operating system are you using?**
MacOS 15

**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/BxrVeJ46Lj

**Describe your issue**

it generates following css with classes like `has-[role=checkbox]:w-px`:
```css
.has-\[role\=checkbox\]\:w-px {
  &:has(*:is(role=checkbox)) {
    width: 1px;
  }
}
```

getting following syntax error with generated css:
```
‚ñ≤ [WARNING] Unexpected "=" [css-syntax-error]

    src/styles.css:864:19:
      864 ‚îÇ     &:has(*:is(role=checkbox)) {
```

let me know whether it is safe to ignore.
